lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are
instructions on how to use it.
**[User Guide](docs/README.md)** - Learn how to use all features
3. See the **[User Guide](docs/README.md)** for detailed commands
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
2. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
2. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
3. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
3. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
4. After that, locate the `src/main/java/nerunerune/Nerunerune.java` file, right-click it, and choose
`Run Nerunerune.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is
correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move
Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle)
- Duke is released under an MIT license.

Nerunerune is a simple task management application that helps you organize deadlines, events, and to-dos efficiently.
The application provides a user-friendly interface to manage your tasks, track deadlines, and schedule events with ease.
Displays a list of all available commands and their usage
Adds a simple task without any date or time
Got it, task added to your task list.
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a task with a specific deadline
Got it, task added to your task list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds an event with start and end times
Got it, task added to your task list.
[E][ ] team meeting (from: Dec 20 2025 2:00 PM to: Dec 20 2025 4:00 PM)
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Displays all tasks in your task list with their status
Here's what's on your task list so far (3 in total):
3. [E][ ] team meeting (from: Dec 20 2025 2:00 PM to: Dec 20 2025 4:00 PM)
`mark backdated` - Marks all overdue deadlines and past events as completed
Mark a task that is completed as not completed
Removes a task from your task list
Got it, task removed from your task list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
`delete all done` - Deletes all completed tasks from the list
Searches for tasks containing a specific or partial keyword (case-sensitive)
Here are all the matching tasks I can find:
Displays all deadlines and events for a specific date or date range
Tasks are automatically saved to your computer after every command. The data file is located at
- Do not manually edit the data file unless you understand the format
- Corrupted data files will be automatically archived or deleted if archiving fails
- The application will create a new data file if the existing one is corrupted
- You forgot to provide task details after the command
- Example fix: Use todo buy milk instead of just todo
- Hours must be between 00-23, minutes between 00-59
- The deadline command is missing the /by keyword
### "Event must contain /from and /to in correct order"
- The event command is missing /from or /to keywords, or they are in wrong order
- Correct format: event task /from start /to end
### "Cannot add event. It clash with existing event"
- The event you're adding overlaps with an existing event
- Check your schedule and choose a different time
- No task matches the description you provided
- Use list to see all tasks and their exact descriptions
Displays all available commands and usage instructions
Creates deadline tasks with exact dates, times, and keyword shortcuts (tomorrow, next month)
deadline task for next week /by next week
deadline task for next month /by next month
Creates events with specific start and end times
Display all tasks in the list with status indicator done[X] /undone [ ]
Marks tasks as complete, uses backdated to mark past tasks, then unmarks to show reversibility.
Marking operates as FIFO, while unmarking operates as LIFO
Searches for tasks by keyword (partial matching) with case-sensitive matching
Shows tasks filtered by date and date ranges (today, tomorrow, specific dates, next week, next month) and demonstrates range scheduling feature. tasks is also group by task type within dates
Deletes tasks by description or index and bulk-deletes all completed tasks

Demonstrates proper error messages for missing descriptions, invalid dates, invalid time, overlapping event, swap parameter, missing parameter, non-existent tasks, empty input, invalid commands and single word command taking argument
Exits app, relaunches it, and shows that all tasks were saved and persisted
Open tasks.txt and corrupt it, launch app and check folder to see corrupted file rename to tasksArchive.txt and fresh new tasks.txt created.
Add a task and check task saved to new file
D | 0 | task for next week | Nov 13 2025 0000
D | 0 | task for next month | Dec 06 2025 0000
D | 0 | return finished reading book | Nov 13 2025 0000
* A launcher class to Nerunerune JavaFX application to workaround classpath issues.
* This class serves as the entry point for the application and provides a workaround
* for classpath and module path issues that can occur when running JavaFX applications
* packaged as JAR files without embedding the JavaFX runtime.
* By using a separate launcher class that does not extend Application, the JVM can
* properly initialize the JavaFX runtime before loading the main Application class.
* Application entry point that launches the Nerunerune JavaFX application.
* @param args Command-line arguments passed to the application
* Main JavaFX Application class for the Nerunerune task management application.
* This class extends Application and manages the overall application lifecycle including
* initialization of core components (UI, storage, task list), loading tasks from persistent
* storage, and coordinating the GUI display.
* Constructs a Nerunerune instance with the specified storage file path.
* Initializes the UI handler, storage manager, and task list.
* Note: This constructor is primarily used for testing or custom file paths.
* The default no-arg constructor is used by JavaFX during normal operation.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored and loaded from
assert filePath != null : "file path should not be null";
assert !filePath.isEmpty() : "file path should not be empty";
* Initializes the application with the default storage file path.
* This constructor is automatically invoked by the JavaFX runtime when
* Initializes the application on the launcher thread before the GUI is created.
* Loads existing tasks from storage. This method is called by JavaFX after
* This method runs on a background thread, making it suitable for time-consuming
* initialization tasks like file I/O without blocking the JavaFX Application Thread.
// AI suggest to refactor to initialize tasks on launcher thread
* Starts the JavaFX application and displays the main window.
* Loads the FXML layout, configures the stage (window), and injects
* dependencies into the controller. This method is called on the
* @param stage The primary stage (window) provided by the JavaFX runtime
* Processes user input and returns the response for GUI display.
* Parses the input into a command, executes it, and captures the output
* for display in the chat interface.
* @param input The user's input string from the GUI text field
* @return The command execution result as a formatted string, or an error message if execution fails
* Represents a command to add a deadline task to the task list.
* Executes the addition of the deadline task and saves the updated task list to storage.
* Constructs an AddDeadlineCommand with the specified task description.
* @param taskString the description of the deadline task to be added
* Executes the command by adding a deadline task to the given task list,
* then save the updated list to storage.
* @param tasks   the task list to add the deadline task
* @param ui      the user interface for interaction
* @param storage the storage instance for saving tasks locally
* @throws NeruneruneException if adding the deadline task fails
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NeruneruneException {
* Represents a command to add an event task to the task list.
* Executes the addition of the event task and saves the updated task list to storage.
* Constructs an AddEventCommand with the specified event description.
* @param taskString the description of the event task to be added
* Executes the command by adding an event task to the given task list,
* then save the updated list to storage.
* @param tasks   the task list to add the event task
* @param ui      the user interface for interaction
* @param storage the storage instance for saving tasks locally
* @throws NeruneruneException if adding the event task fails
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NeruneruneException {
* Represents a command to add a todo task to the task list.
* Executes the addition of the todo task and saves the updated task list to storage.
* Constructs an AddTodoCommand with the specified todo description.
* @param taskString the description of the todo task to be added
* Executes the command by adding a todo task to the given task list,
* then save the updated list to storage.
* @param tasks   the task list to add the todo task
* @param ui      the user interface for interaction
* @param storage the storage instance for saving tasks locally
* @throws NeruneruneException if adding the todo task fails
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NeruneruneException {
* Represents an abstract base class for commands in the application.
* Defines the structure for executing commands and determining if a command exits the program.
* Executes the command using the provided task list, UI, and storage.
* @param tasks   the task list to be operated on
* @param ui      the user interface component for interaction
* @param storage the storage component for saving or loading tasks locally
* @throws NeruneruneException if an error occurs during execution
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NeruneruneException;
* Indicates whether this command causes the application to exit.
* @return true if the command causes the program to exit, false otherwise
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Executes the deletion of the specified task and saves the updated task list to storage.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task identifier or description.
* @param taskString the identifier or description of the task to be deleted
* Executes the command by deleting the specified task from the given task list,
* then save the updated list to storage.
* @param tasks   the task list to delete the task from
* @param ui      the user interface for interaction
* @param storage the storage instance for saving tasks locally
* @throws NeruneruneException if deleting the task fails
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NeruneruneException {
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* Executes the exit process by displaying the end message and signals the program to terminate.
* Executes the exit command by displaying the end message to the user.
* @param ui      the user interface to display the end message
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that this command causes the application to exit.
* @return true always, signaling the program should terminate
* Represents a command to find tasks containing a specific keyword in their description.
* Searches through the task list and displays all matching tasks to the user.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified search keyword.
* @param taskString The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* Executes the find command by searching for tasks containing the keyword
* and displaying the results through the UI.
* @param tasks   The task list to search through.
* @param ui      The user interface handler for displaying results.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
* @throws NeruneruneException If an error occurs during execution.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NeruneruneException {
* Represents a command to mark a task as completed in the task list.
* Executes the marking of the specified task and saves the updated task list to storage.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified task identifier or description.
* @param taskString the identifier or description of the task to be marked as done
* Executes the command by marking the specified task as completed in the given task list,
* then save the updated list to storage.
* @param tasks   the task list containing the task to mark
* @param ui      the user interface for interaction
* @param storage the storage instance for saving tasks locally
* @throws NeruneruneException if marking the task fails
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NeruneruneException {
* Represents a command to print the entire task list.
* Executes the display of all tasks managed in the task list.
* Executes the command by listing all tasks in the given task list.
* @param tasks   the task list to be displayed
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to view the schedule for a specific date or date range.
* When executed, displays all tasks (deadlines and events) scheduled for the given date or range.
* Supports single dates (e.g., "today", "tomorrow", "25-10-2025") and date ranges (e.g., "next week", "next month").
* Constructs a ScheduleCommand with the specified date string.
* Executes the schedule command by displaying tasks scheduled for the specified date or range.
* Delegates to the UI to format and show the schedule view with tasks grouped by date and type.
* @param tasks   the task list containing all tasks
* @param ui      the user interface to display the schedule
* @throws NeruneruneException if an error occurs during execution or date parsing
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NeruneruneException {
* Represents a command to unmark a task as not completed in the task list.
* Executes the unmarking of the specified task and saves the updated task list to storage.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified task identifier or description.
* @param taskString the identifier or description of the task to be unmarked
* Executes the command by unmarking the specified task as not completed in the given task list,
* then save the updated list to storage.
* @param tasks   the task list containing the task to unmark
* @param ui      the user interface for interaction
* @param storage the storage instance for saving tasks locally
* @throws NeruneruneException if unmarking the task fails
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NeruneruneException {
* Represents a command to display the user guide or help message.
* Executes the command by printing the user guide message via the UI.
* Executes the command by displaying the user guide message to the user.
* @param ui      the user interface to display the user guide message
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a dialog box consisting of an ImageView to represent the speaker's face
* and a Label containing text from the speaker.
* This custom control extends HBox and loads its layout from DialogBox.fxml.
* It provides factory methods to create dialog boxes for both user messages
* (image on right) and bot responses (image on left).
private static final DateTimeFormatter TIME_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("h:mm a");
* Creates a DialogBox with the specified text and image.
* The dialog box is loaded from DialogBox.fxml with this instance
* set as both the controller and root node.
* @param text The message text to display in the dialog box
* @param img  The profile image to display alongside the text
* Creates a dialog box for user messages.
* The dialog box is aligned to the right with the image on the right side.
* @return A DialogBox formatted for user messages
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Creates a dialog box for bot responses.
* The dialog box is aligned to the left with the image on the left side,
* achieved by flipping the default layout.
* @return A DialogBox formatted for bot responses
public static DialogBox getNeruneruneDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Flips the dialog box layout such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.
* Also changes the alignment to TOP_LEFT and applies the "reply-label" CSS style class
* to visually distinguish bot responses from user messages.
// flip timestamp to the left for bot reply
* Controller for the main GUI window of the Nerunerune application.
* Manages user interactions, displays chat messages in dialog boxes,
* and coordinates communication between the UI and the application logic.
* This controller is linked to MainWindow.fxml and handles the display
* of user messages and bot responses in a scrollable chat interface.
* Initializes the controller after FXML elements have been loaded.
* Sets up the auto-scrolling behavior for the dialog container and
* displays the welcome message when the application starts.
* This method is automatically called by the FXMLLoader after all
* FXML tag annotated fields have been injected.
* Loads the profile images for user and bot.
* Provides error handling if image resources cannot be found.
System.err.println("Error: Could not load user image (hachiware.jpg)");
System.err.println("Error: Could not load bot image (usagi.jpg)");
* Creates a default placeholder image when actual images cannot be loaded.
* Uses a generic profile icon as fallback.
System.err.println("Could not load default profile icon");
* Injects the Nerunerune application instance into the controller.
* This allows the controller to communicate with the application logic
* Handles user input from the text field.
* Creates two dialog boxes: one displaying the user's input and another
* containing the bot's response. Both dialog boxes are appended to the
* dialog container for display. The input field is cleared after processing.
* This method is triggered when the user presses Enter in the text field
* Simple custom exception class for errors specific to Nerunerune application.
* Used to indicate issues encountered during program execution.
* Constructs a NeruneruneException with the specified error message.
* @param message the detail message explaining the reason for the exception
* Provides utility methods to parse and format date-time strings
* Handles conversion between user input, storage format,
* and display format for date and time.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd-MM-yyyy HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy h:mm a");
private static final DateTimeFormatter STORAGE_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HHmm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter LONG_DATE_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("EEEE, dd MMM yyyy");
* Parses a date-time string from user input.
* Accepts strings either with just a date (dd-MM-yyyy) or with date and time (dd-MM-yyyy HHmm).
* Returns a LocalDateTime object with time set to start of day if only date is given (dd-MM-yyyy 0000).
* @return LocalDateTime parsed from the input string
* @throws NeruneruneException if input format is invalid or time is out of range
public static LocalDateTime parseDateTime(String dateTimeString) throws NeruneruneException {

throw new NeruneruneException("Invalid storage date/time format");

* Handle extraction and validation of command keywords and arguments,

* Manages reading and writing tasks to persistent storage.

* Handles corrupted storage files by renaming them to an archive,

taskList.clear(); // clear the task list as loading failed

public void readStorageFile(File f, ArrayList<Task> taskList) throws NeruneruneException, IOException {

* Represents a deadline task with a specific date and time by which it must be completed.
* Extends the Task class with an additional time attribute.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and deadline timing.
* @param deadlineDescription description of the deadline task
* @param byTiming            the date and time by which the task should be completed
* Constructs a Deadline task with the given description and completion status.
* @param deadlineDescription description of the deadline task
* @param isDone              whether the task is marked as done
* Constructs a Deadline task with description, deadline timing, and completion status.
* @param deadlineDescription description of the deadline task
* @param byTiming            the date and time by which the task should be completed
* @param isDone              whether the task is marked as done
public Deadline(String deadlineDescription, LocalDateTime byTiming, boolean isDone) {
* Returns the type of schedule item this task represents.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task for display,
* including type, status, description, and formatted deadline timing.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task for storage,
* including type, done status, description, and formatted timing.
* Returns the deadline date and time for this Deadline task.
* @return the deadline LocalDateTime indicating when the task is due
* Checks if this deadline has passed.
* Compares the deadline's due date with the current date and time.
* @return true if the deadline is before the current date and time, false otherwise
* Checks whether this deadline task occurs on the specified date.
* Compares only the date portion of the deadline, ignoring the time component.
* @return true if the deadline's date matches the specified date, false otherwise
* Represents an event task with a start and an end time.
* Extends Task and includes from and to timing.
* Constructs an Event with description, start time, end time, and completion status.
* @param isDone           whether the task is marked as done
public Event(String eventDescription, LocalDateTime eventFromTiming, LocalDateTime eventToTiming, boolean isDone) {
* Constructs an Event with description, start time, and end time. Defaults to not done.
public Event(String eventDescription, LocalDateTime eventFromTiming, LocalDateTime eventToTiming) {
* Constructs an Event with description and completion status. Timing is unspecified.
* @param isDone           whether the task is marked as done
* Returns a string representation of the event for display, including status icon,
* description, and formatted from and to timings.
* Returns a string suitable for storage, including task type, status, description,
* Returns the start date and time for this Event task.
* @return the start LocalDateTime indicating when the event begins
* Returns the end date and time for this Event task.
* @return the end LocalDateTime indicating when the event concludes
* Checks if this event has ended.
* Compares the event's end time with the current date and time.
* @return true if the event's end time is before the current date and time, false otherwise
* Checks whether this event task occurs on the specified date.
* Compares only the date portion of the deadline, ignoring the time component.
* An event occurs on a date if the date falls within the event's duration
* from the start date to the end date.
* @return true if the date is within the event's start and end dates, false otherwise
* Abstract base class representing a task.
* Contains common properties and methods for all task types,
* such as description, completion status, and abstract methods for specific behavior.
* Constructs a Task with the given description.
* @param description the description of the task
* Constructs a Task with the given description and completion status.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param isDone      true if the task is completed, false otherwise
* Returns the status icon representing completion state.
* @return "X" if done, otherwise a space character
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns whether the task is marked as done.
* Abstract method to identify the type of schedule item.
* @return the type of schedule item as a string
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task for display.
* Returns a string representation of the task for storage.
* Checks if this task is backdated (date/time has passed).
